clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Impact of Delta-haemolysin Production Deficiency in Staphylococcus Aureus on the Prognosis of Infected Implant Treated by DAIR
clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Impact of Delta-haemolysin Production Deficiency in Staphylococcus Aureus on the Prognosis of Infected Implant Treated by DAIR

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine if delta-haemolysin production deficiency of Staphylococcus aureus is a marker in favour of chronic infections on implants

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of infection with or witout delta-haemolysin in Staphylococcus Aureus
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
primary_outcome.description: patients, profile of the bacterium, medical and chirurgical treatment, rate. comparison between the 2 groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined by local clinical and/or microbiological relapse; and/or need for additional surgery; death of septic origin. Analyse of risk factor. Comparison between the 2 groups

arm_group.description: Implant infected by Staphylococcus aureus with delta-haemolysin Production Deficiency
Implant infected by Staphylococcus aureus with delta-haemolysin Production

intervention.description: comparison of groups having infection with S. aureus with and without delta-haemolysin Production

study_pop.textblock: patients having implant infection due to S. aureus treated by DAIR managed at the Lyon Bone and joint infection reference Center between 2006 and 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients having implant infection due to S. aureus treated by DAIR
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
